meanings.definition: The act of passing over or disregarding something.
meanings.sent1: Her pretermission of the homework assignment led to a lower grade.
meanings.sent2: The pretermission of his name on the list caused confusion.
meanings.sent3: The pretermission of the 'no pets allowed' sign resulted in chaos when a dog ran through the store.
meanings.sent4: His pretermission of the warning signs was like walking blindly into a storm.
meanings.sent5: The pretermission of safety precautions made the situation extremely dangerous.

meanings.definition: Failure to do something that should have been done.
meanings.sent1: The pretermission of her daily chores upset her parents.
meanings.sent2: His pretermission of the deadline led to a missed opportunity.
meanings.sent3: The pretermission of feeding the cat resulted in a very hungry feline.
meanings.sent4: Her pretermission of studying for the test was a recipe for disaster.
meanings.sent5: The pretermission of locking the door left the house vulnerable to intruders.
